verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the king sat in his house, and the LORD had given him rest round about from all his enemies;
verses.web: When the king lived in his house, and LORD had given him rest from all his enemies all around,
verses.ct: Once the king had settled into his palace and the LORD had given him peace from all his enemies on every side,

verses.kjv: That the king said unto Nathan the prophet, See now, I dwell in an house of cedar, but the ark of God dwelleth within curtains.
verses.web: the king said to Nathan the prophet, “See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but God’s ark dwells within curtains.”
verses.ct: the king said to Nathan the prophet, "Look — I'm living in a palace built of cedar, but the ark of God sits inside a tent with nothing but curtains around it."

verses.kjv: And Nathan said to the king, Go, do all that is in thine heart; for the LORD is with thee.
verses.web: Nathan said to the king, “Go, do all that is in your heart; for LORD is with you.”
verses.ct: Nathan told the king, "Go ahead and do whatever is on your heart, because the LORD is with you."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass that night, that the word of the LORD came unto Nathan, saying,
verses.web: That same night, LORD’s word came to Nathan, saying,
verses.ct: But that very night, the word of the LORD came to Nathan:

verses.kjv: Go and tell my servant David, Thus saith the LORD, Shalt thou build me an house for me to dwell in?
verses.web: “Go and tell my servant David, ‘LORD says, “Should you build me a house for me to dwell in?
verses.ct: "Go and tell my servant David, 'This is what the LORD says: Are you the one who should build me a house to live in?

verses.kjv: Whereas I have not dwelt in any house since the time that I brought up the children of Israel out of Egypt, even to this day, but have walked in a tent and in a tabernacle.
verses.web: For I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought the children of Israel up out of Egypt, even to this day, but have moved around in a tent and in a tabernacle.
verses.ct: I haven't lived in a house from the day I brought the people of Israel out of Egypt until now. Instead, I've been moving from place to place in a tent and a tabernacle.

verses.kjv: In all the places wherein I have walked with all the children of Israel spake I a word with any of the tribes of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people Israel, saying, Why build ye not me an house of cedar?
verses.web: In all places in which I have walked with all the children of Israel, did I say a word to any of the tribes of Israel, whom I commanded to be shepherd of my people Israel, saying, ‘Why have you not built me a house of cedar?’ ” ’
verses.ct: In all the places I've traveled with the people of Israel, did I ever say to any of the tribal leaders I appointed to shepherd my people Israel, "Why haven't you built me a house of cedar?"'

verses.kjv: Now therefore so shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote, from following the sheep, to be ruler over my people, over Israel:
verses.web: Now therefore tell my servant David this, ‘LORD of Armies says, “I took you from the sheep pen, from following the sheep, to be prince over my people, over Israel.
verses.ct: "So tell my servant David, 'The LORD of hosts says: I took you from the pasture, from following sheep, and made you ruler over my people Israel.

verses.kjv: And I was with thee whithersoever thou wentest, and have cut off all thine enemies out of thy sight, and have made thee a great name, like unto the name of the great men that are in the earth.
verses.web: I have been with you wherever you went, and have cut off all your enemies from before you. I will make you a great name, like the name of the great ones who are in the earth.
verses.ct: I've been with you everywhere you've gone. I destroyed all your enemies before you. And I will make your name as great as the greatest names on earth.

verses.kjv: Moreover I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own, and move no more; neither shall the children of wickedness afflict them any more, as beforetime,
verses.web: I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place, and be moved no more. The children of wickedness will not afflict them any more, as at the first,
verses.ct: I will establish a homeland for my people Israel and plant them there so they can live in their own place and never be uprooted again. Violent and wicked people will no longer oppress them the way they did before,

verses.kjv: And as since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel, and have caused thee to rest from all thine enemies. Also the LORD telleth thee that he will make thee an house.
verses.web: and as from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. I will cause you to rest from all your enemies. Moreover LORD tells you that LORD will make you a house.
verses.ct: as they have since the time I appointed judges to lead my people Israel. I will give you rest from all your enemies. And beyond that, the LORD declares that he will build a house for you —

verses.kjv: And when thy days be fulfilled, and thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, I will set up thy seed after thee, which shall proceed out of thy bowels, and I will establish his kingdom.
verses.web: When your days are fulfilled, and you sleep with your fathers, I will set up your offspring after you, who will proceed out of your body, and I will establish his kingdom.
verses.ct: a dynasty. When your life comes to an end and you die and are buried with your ancestors, I will raise up one of your own descendants to succeed you, and I will establish his kingdom.

verses.kjv: He shall build an house for my name, and I will stablish the throne of his kingdom for ever.
verses.web: He will build a house for my name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever.
verses.ct: He is the one who will build a house for my name, and I will make his royal throne last forever.

verses.kjv: I will be his father, and he shall be my son. If he commit iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men:
verses.web: I will be his father, and he will be my son. If he commits iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men;
verses.ct: I will be his father, and he will be my son. When he does wrong, I will discipline him the way any father would — with the same kind of correction that people give their children.

verses.kjv: But my mercy shall not depart away from him, as I took it from Saul, whom I put away before thee.
verses.web: but my loving kindness will not depart from him, as I took it from Saul, whom I put away before you.
verses.ct: But my mercy will never be taken from him the way I took it from Saul, whom I removed to make room for you.

verses.kjv: And thine house and thy kingdom shall be established for ever before thee: thy throne shall be established for ever.
verses.web: Your house and your kingdom will be made sure forever before you. Your throne will be established forever.” ’ ”
verses.ct: Your house and your kingdom will stand firm before you forever. Your throne will be established for all time.'"

verses.kjv: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.
verses.web: Nathan spoke to David all these words, and according to all this vision.
verses.ct: Nathan reported every word of this vision to David, exactly as God had revealed it.

verses.kjv: Then went king David in, and sat before the LORD, and he said, Who am I, O Lord GOD? and what is my house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?
verses.web: Then David the king went in, and sat before LORD; and he said, “Who am I, Lord LORD, and what is my house, that you have brought me this far?
verses.ct: Then King David went in and sat before the LORD. He said, "Who am I, Lord GOD? And what is my family, that you have brought me this far?

verses.kjv: And this was yet a small thing in thy sight, O Lord GOD; but thou hast spoken also of thy servant’s house for a great while to come. And is this the manner of man, O Lord GOD?
verses.web: This was yet a small thing in your eyes, Lord LORD; but you have spoken also of your servant’s house for a great while to come; and this among men, Lord LORD!
verses.ct: And as if that weren't enough, Lord GOD, you've also spoken about the future of my family for generations to come. Is this really how you deal with ordinary people, Lord GOD?

verses.kjv: And what can David say more unto thee? for thou, Lord GOD, knowest thy servant.
verses.web: What more can David say to you? For you know your servant, Lord LORD.
verses.ct: What more can David possibly say to you? You already know your servant through and through, Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: For thy word’s sake, and according to thine own heart, hast thou done all these great things, to make thy servant know them.
verses.web: For your word’s sake, and according to your own heart, you have worked all this greatness, to make your servant know it.
verses.ct: Because of your promise, and because of your own heart's desire, you have done all these incredible things and revealed them to your servant.

verses.kjv: Wherefore thou art great, O LORD God: for there is none like thee, neither is there any God beside thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.web: Therefore you are great, LORD God. For there is no one like you, neither is there any God besides you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.ct: This is why you are so great, LORD God. There is no one like you. There is no God besides you — everything we've ever heard confirms it.

verses.kjv: And what one nation in the earth is like thy people, even like Israel, whom God went to redeem for a people to himself, and to make him a name, and to do for you great things and terrible, for thy land, before thy people, which thou redeemedst to thee from Egypt, from the nations and their gods?
verses.web: What one nation in the earth is like your people, even like Israel, whom God went to redeem to himself for a people, and to make himself a name, and to do great things for you, and awesome things for your land, before your people, whom you redeemed to yourself out of Egypt, from the nations and their gods?
verses.ct: And what nation on earth is like your people Israel? You are the God who went out to redeem a people for yourself, to make a name for yourself, and to do great and awesome things for your land — driving out nations and their gods before your people, the ones you rescued from Egypt.

verses.kjv: For thou hast confirmed to thyself thy people Israel to be a people unto thee for ever: and thou, LORD, art become their God.
verses.web: You established for yourself your people Israel to be your people forever; and you, LORD, became their God.
verses.ct: You established Israel as your own people forever, and you, LORD, became their God.

verses.kjv: And now, O LORD God, the word that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant, and concerning his house, establish it for ever, and do as thou hast said.
verses.web: Now, LORD God, the word that you have spoken concerning your servant, and concerning his house, confirm it forever, and do as you have spoken.
verses.ct: So now, LORD God, the promise you've made about your servant and his family — let it stand forever. Do exactly what you've said.

verses.kjv: And let thy name be magnified for ever, saying, The LORD of hosts is the God over Israel: and let the house of thy servant David be established before thee.
verses.web: Let your name be magnified forever, saying, ‘LORD of Armies is God over Israel; and the house of your servant David will be established before you.’
verses.ct: Let your name be honored forever, so that people will say, 'The LORD of hosts is God over Israel.' And let the house of your servant David be established in your presence.

verses.kjv: For thou, O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, hast revealed to thy servant, saying, I will build thee an house: therefore hath thy servant found in his heart to pray this prayer unto thee.
verses.web: For you, LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, have revealed to your servant, saying, ‘I will build you a house.’ Therefore your servant has found in his heart to pray this prayer to you.
verses.ct: For you, LORD of hosts, God of Israel, revealed this to your servant when you said, 'I will build you a dynasty.' That is why your servant has found the courage to pray this prayer to you.

verses.kjv: And now, O Lord GOD, thou art that God, and thy words be true, and thou hast promised this goodness unto thy servant:
verses.web: “Now, O Lord LORD, you are God, and your words are truth, and you have promised this good thing to your servant.
verses.ct: Lord GOD, you are God. Your words are true, and you have promised this wonderful thing to your servant.

verses.kjv: Therefore now let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may continue for ever before thee: for thou, O Lord GOD, hast spoken it: and with thy blessing let the house of thy servant be blessed for ever.
verses.web: Now therefore let it please you to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue forever before you; for you, Lord LORD, have spoken it. Let the house of your servant be blessed forever with your blessing.”
verses.ct: So now, please bless the house of your servant so that it will continue forever in your presence. For you, Lord GOD, have spoken it — and with your blessing, let your servant's house be blessed forever."
